summary: Fixes the "Missing TESCombatStyle form" CTD encountered while wandering the world.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#f9cb9c]Hello again. After over 8,000 hours of wandering Skyrim and all that time being plagued by mysterious CTDs while simply walking the land, I had nearly become so sick of them that I contemplated uninstalling Skyrim. [/color][b][color=#ffe599]Then I found a very nice mod called "Crash Fixes" by "meh21" ([/color][color=#00ffff]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72725/[/color][color=#ffe599]) that remedied quite a few old CTD demons while also doing an equally useful service of pointing out offending NPCs and objects causing CTD events. [/color][/b][color=#b6d7a8]Thanks for that, meh21.

[/color][color=#a2c4c9]After loading TES5Edit and typing in the ID number that "Crash Fixes" supplied me with, I was directed to an odd looking template for a spawn point for ambient creatures. Namely, a shifty looking fox and snow fox. [/color][color=#a4c2f4]After reading through their files, I noticed they used a template for something that wasn't a fox or snow fox. [/color][color=#ff7700][b]This was what was causing the CTD events.

[/b][/color][color=#93c47d]My mod remedies this by using the correct template for the actor and after a full playthrough, I haven't had anymore CTD events caused by these shifty looking foxes.[/color]

[b][color=#ff00ff]Only requirement is Skyrim.esm. [/color][color=#e06666]Does not require "Crash Fixes".[/color]

[color=#ff0000]A side effect I've been notified of will no longer allow rabbits to spawn while using my fix. [/color][color=#00ff00]Bethesda's hand-placed locations like Spriggan lairs and some shrines still spawn rabbits.[/color][color=#ff0000] [/color]Adding the rabbit's record to any other "LCharAnimalxPrey" spawn list using "TES5Edit" will also add rabbits back to the world.

[/b][color=#00ff00][size=4][b]Hot files 8-13-2018 to 8-19-18! Thanks for that!

[/b][/size][/color][b][size=3]Skyrim SE port by ff7legend. ([color=#00ffff]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/19265[/color])[/size][/b]

[color=#ffff00]Thanks for looking, I hope this helps you all as well as it has me.[/color]
author: Armored Troll
